com.smjourney.entity

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smjourney.entity.Entity
      • com.smjourney.entity.Ship
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Destructible, Moveable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttackShip, BeamShip, Mothership, ScoutShip, SupportShip

    public class Ship
extends Entity
implements Moveable, Destructible
    A functioning starship that operates with its own shields, energy capacity, thruster power, and attack power. Shields dictate the attack power that the ship can resist from enemy ships before being destroyed. Energy capacity dictates the extent to which a ship can function (moving, attacking, etc.) Thruster power dictates how far a ship can move on the map using a unit of energy. Attack power dictates the damage that a ship can deal to another ship on the map. Each ship is automatically assigned randomized stats upon construction based on the type of ship that is constructed. Each ship also has a designated square-size like an Entity Ships can also be designated as enemies for control by artificial intelligence.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()

        Specified by:
        canMove in interface Moveable
        Returns:
        canMove true if the ship can move forward, false if not

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(CellGroup target)
        Moves the ship to a certain target cell group on the map.
        Specified by:
        moveTo in interface Moveable
        Parameters:
        target - the target cell group
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - this ship is not on a map
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the map contains different entities at the target
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the target cell group's size does not correspond to that of the ship's
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - target is not valid

      • moveForward

        public void moveForward()
        Moves the ship forward by one unit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The ship is not on a map to move on.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Ship cannot move forward.

      • operate

        public void operate()
        Carries out the special function of the ship (default: unbalanced attack function) (turns ship to attack if necessary)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - There is no target specified or ship is depleted.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The target is out of range.
